name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
11/11
And so, all these little things add up.
Since we are on https://t.co/prwVxltWAJ I need to address that there are always exceptions, obviously - and you CAN go freelance in this country too.
+ 12/11 below:

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
10/11
I have 15-20 orders online when I open my web shop. My reach is different because I live in the EU, and the 2021 EU internet laws probably also affect our reach (I’m not sure about this one, though, but it seems like it). It is very difficult to ship to US from here.

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
9/11

Why not go to abroad, then? Most of us do. Young people are going abroad at an alarming rate. But many people don’t have money to travel. I personally have never been to abroad, but I learned everything I could to do online work (language, culture, norms, etc.)

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
8/11
People in general don’t really appreciate art in here, and since it’s a very small country, the demographic that is interested is not much and they often can’t pay much money for art.

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
7/11
Want to have a job in animation? Good luck. Some jobs in the animation industry, such as concept artists, don’t even exist here.

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
6/11
95% of my orders comes from the US.
We are a small country and rather poor, where people hold onto every single coins they earn. I’ve got complaints for $2-3 shipping prices because people never want to spend more money than what’s absolutely necessary (and for a reason).

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
5/11
We don’t have big conventions, or even small ones really, where artists could earn a lot of money. What sells for $100+ in the US can be sold for $15 here. We don’t have many good quality factories, so you won’t be making good quality merch easily. Let's not mention LGBT+.

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
4/11
What's natural in the US, like tipping, is often unimaginable in here; people wouldn’t pay more money than the original price, and often times, even that is too much. What sells for $100+ in the US can be sold for $15 here (I’m not exaggerating).

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
3/11
There are so many things I could address, but my main point is to show you some insights on how differently some simple things might work.
US is the norm for most people, even for those who don’t live there - it's hard to find good advices that aren't based on US standards.

name: Boka 🥀
tweet:
2/11

In this thread my purpose is not to complain! I am just showing you differences. I am hoping that people would understand that in most cases it is probably harder to build a freelance career if your location isn’t generally appreciating towards art.
